intro: Centaurium suaveolens, commonly known as sweet centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy surface. The species is known for its aromatic fragrance, which is released when the flowers open.
